caption: One of the most iconic places to visit in Paris. The view is amazing especially at night. It is always busy. there are sometimes street vendors for souvenirs. There are bus stops close and you can walk over to the Eiffel tower.
"Photos taken on the stairs with the Eiffel Tower in the background are excellent. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the square is wonderful."

If it's the museum you're visiting, then you need to pay a fee, if it's the outer side and the Trocad√©ro Place, then it's free. A really nice place for great pictures.  Take your time here to enjoy everything around, from restaurants to cafe.
Its good to come early morning like 8am if you want to do shoot with empty background! Very beautiful park and around

This spot offers one of the best views of the Eiffel Tower. Even though it was rainy when I visited, the views were still nice. It's a spacious square. I recommend arriving early in the morning to avoid the crowds.Its also spectacular at nights
It's a really beautiful place on Trocad√©ro. It contains a total of 4 museums within it. And you can have the best view of the Eiffel from any of the museums inside

What an absolutely spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower. I did not expect to be so in awe of this view but I was. I recommend visiting during the day and at night once the Eiffel Tower begins to sparkle. ‚ú® It feels magical!

Went to this location for New Years Eve. Such a great view!  Was totally packed with a ton of people. Standing room shoulder to shoulder. Public transportation was a hot mess afterwards so we walked back to the hotel. Would do it again!
Not only is this a great place from which to see the Eiffel Tower, it is a great place to see from the Eiffel tower.

Nice big open parking lot for people where you can get a great view of the iron pointer at sunrise.  I think I saw like five brides getting pics in front of the steel stick.  Makes u think üí≠  Still five stars here r some picsssss

Cross the road and you can see the majestic Eiffel Tower, face to face in all its glory. Huge open, happening space, always full of tourists, many vendors selling souvenirs. There are also photographers ready to take professional photos with the tower. To the right is the statue of Hercules and right in front is the huge terrace  and the grill where people hang their lovelocks. There's a staircase on each side, leading towards the gardens.

Nice architecture of the building and nice view on Eiffel tower. Just one think what I seriously didn't like was all fences covered with locksüîí (of love?). It's horrible, it's sign of vandalism not love. I will appreciate if people can stop do in it and take it down. ‚Ä¶

If I try to take a picture of the Eiffel Tower in Paris as the background, I think this would be the best view. You can see the Eiffel Tower anywhere, but if you recommend one place, this is the place.

This place is always packed with tourists and photographers morning, noon, and evening, weekend and weekdays, because it has Esplanade Joseph Wresinsksi where you can look over the Jardins du Trocad√©ro and have the direct view of the magnificent Eiffel tower. There are people offers miniatures of Eiffel and other souvenirs. Be careful always with your belongings here!
The sculpture's chest and genitals were scratched and the paint peeled off. This is very uncivilized. Can the government repaint them?

Favorite place for some memorable photos every time when we come back to Paris. The view never gets old and the atmosphere is great (especially on the sunrise). In the evening it gets way too crowded and people try to sell you useless stuff from every corner. So timing is key.
An amazing historical Parisian monumet that harbors a museum. I love what they‚Äôve done for the olympics 2024
We visited on the day after the opening ceremony of the olympics but the site was still covered by the infrastructure. Not sure if now it opens up to the public a little bit?
Here you can have a nice view of Eiffel Tower. If you are lucky you can get fountain shower that give a nice look to your view and photos that you can keep as memory for life.
Is the best place to take a picture with the Eiffel tower. The whole building has areas that are been restored now. We went also to the architecture museum there. It's a nice place to walk
The views of the Eiffel tour are amazing‚Ä¶can get very crowded at night time‚Ä¶be careful with all the crowds pickpockets love that
We just stopped here for the view of the Eiffel Tower and were glad we did! This seems to be the best view of the tower in the city, and is a large enough area to hold a lot of people.
Great place to view the Eiffel Tower

The Palais definitely offers one of the best views of the Eiffel Tower in the city and panorama around the site.  Because of how well-known the Palais is to tourists, it does get really busy during the day and it could distract from the beauty of the Palais and it‚Äôs a little difficult to get a nice photo with the crowds.  However, it‚Äôs a must-see spot to visit in Paris and coming here in the early morning around sunrise would be the best time to visit and avoid the crowds.

Been there in the so-called architecture museum a great place to glance at pieces (and or replicas) of clasical buidlings (modern ones on the upper floors where th√© caf√©t√©ria). From the museum outstanding view of the Eiffel tower

We didn't go into the museum but just the esplanade out front. The esplanade is located inside Trocadero Park at the top of the fountain. This area is also close to where the museum is. We didn't go into the museum but did spend a bit of time here taking a few photos of the Eiffel Tower. I could see why this place would give a really nice vantage but it was a bit foggy when we were there so the tower was incomplete. Even though it wasn't the best day for taking pictures of the tower it was still quite busy. The garden is also a nice place to walk around so it isn't a bad place to visit.

An excellent place start the visit to Eiffel Tower.  You have a commending view of the tower from distance overlooking this iconic Paris attraction.  The walk through the garden and crossing the bridge over river Seine towards the tower is very enjoyable.

The Palais de Chaillot in Paris is a true gem that shouldn't be missed. This architectural masterpiece offers a captivating experience with its stunning design and panoramic views of the city. As I entered the Palais de Chaillot, I was immediately taken aback by its elegance and grandeur.  Inside, the museum houses an impressive collection of art and historical exhibits that provide a deep insight into France's rich cultural heritage. The spacious halls and thoughtfully curated displays create a captivating atmosphere that appeals to both art enthusiasts and history lovers alike. However, the highlight of my visit was undoubtedly the terrace, where I was treated to a breathtaking view of the iconic Eiffel Tower. The sight was simply mesmerizing, especially during sunset when the tower seemed to radiate a golden glow, creating a truly magical experience.  For those seeking a blend of architectural magnificence, cultural enrichment, and stunning vistas, the Palais de Chaillot is a must-visit destination. Its allure will leave you captivated, and the memories of this extraordinary place will stay with you long after your visit.

one simply cannot miss the enchanting Palais de Chaillot. This architectural gem, located in the heart of the city, offers a captivating blend of history, culture, and breathtaking views that left me in awe during my recent visit. From its magnificent fa√ßade to its well-curated exhibitions, the Palais de Chaillot exceeded my expectations in every way.  Upon arriving at the Palais de Chaillot, I was immediately struck by the grandeur of its design. The neoclassical architecture, with its imposing columns and ornate details, commands attention and evokes a sense of grandiosity. The spacious esplanade surrounding the palace provides an excellent vantage point to admire the iconic Eiffel Tower and the stunning cityscape of Paris.  Inside, the Palais de Chaillot houses several museums and exhibition spaces that showcase a diverse range of art and history. The Cit√© de l'Architecture et du Patrimoine allows visitors to explore the evolution of French architecture through immersive displays and interactive exhibits. From the medieval period to modernist movements, the museum offers a comprehensive journey through time, shedding light on the rich architectural heritage of France.  The Mus√©e de l'Homme, located within the Palais de Chaillot, is another highlight not to be missed. It delves into the depths of human anthropology, presenting thought-provoking displays that shed light on our origins, diversity, and interconnectedness as a species. The museum's collection is both educational and engaging, and it offers a unique perspective on what it means to be human.  One of the true highlights of my visit to Palais de Chaillot was undoubtedly the panoramic terrace. The terrace offers unparalleled views of Paris, providing an unobstructed vista of the Eiffel Tower, the Seine River, and the surrounding landmarks. Whether during the day or at night when the city lights up, the panorama from the Palais de Chaillot is nothing short of magical. It's an ideal spot for capturing stunning photographs and creating lasting memories.  Additionally, the Palais de Chaillot benefits from excellent amenities, including well-maintained facilities and knowledgeable staff. The visitor services team was friendly, helpful, and readily available to answer any questions, making the overall experience even more enjoyable.  In conclusion, a visit to Palais de Chaillot is an absolute must for any traveler in Paris. Its striking architecture, fascinating museums, and unparalleled views make it a true gem in the city's cultural landscape. Whether you're a history enthusiast, an art lover, or simply seeking breathtaking vistas, the Palais de Chaillot promises an unforgettable experience that will leave you with a newfound appreciation for the beauty of Paris and its rich heritage.
We went to the square at night to view the Eiffel Tower. Amazing view. We had very delicious crepes from a kiosk.

I would say 4 stars because this is one of the best places for a view of the Eiffel Tower but this is also one of the busiest tourist places in Paris.  This is one of the major spots for pickpockets. I had a gf have her bag stolen with her wallet and camera and it‚Äôs was 6am.  There is always so many people here drinking and sometimes it‚Äôs just full of garbage. This is one of my least favourite places as a resident.

A beautiful view of Eiffel Tower from here. People just gathered around take some of their great moments from here.. a large fountain down makes it even more beautiful. If you are doing hop on hop off from big bus then this would be your last stop. There are some nice restaurants around.

It was built for the 1937 Universal Exposition in the neoclassical style. In this palace the General Assembly of the United Nations adopted the Universal Declaration of Human Rights in 1948. This is why in 1985 the central esplanade of the palace was named Parvis (square) of the Liberties and Rights of Man. From here you have a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower.

Having a great location to appreciate the Eiffel Tower, weather plays an crucially important role for our trip for sure. You can see the difference from my attached photos. Only annoyed part is there are many Africans guy selling their ‚Äúsouvenirs‚Äù to tourists, it is indeed annoying to me and it hurt the city‚Äôs imagination..... Anyway our personal safety is still fine.

This is a very touristic spot and s great one too! I can honestly say that coming here at any time of day and weather is worth it. The view of the Eiffel Tower is incredible that you won‚Äôt be disappointed! I usually come here to have a walk, take pictures or just to enjoy the view. There is a lot of space to walk around as well. And it‚Äôs close distance to cute restaurant and cafes. Make sure to put this spot on your must see location to visit when in Paris!!

Here you can have a very good and clear view to take pictures with Eiffel Tower. The only problem is finding a clear spot without people to do that. The Tower is 5 to 10 min walking and if you have any disabilities this place is the top of the hill. So it is better to start here and go to the Tower instead of walking in the opposite direction.

Iconic location for photos of the Eiffel Tower. By far the clearest views of the tower. Aside from the views, the architecture is also unique and the plaza is massive, with the two staircases leading up to it from the Trocadero Gardens. It does look a lot better on sunny days, so try to plan around that, at least better than we did. On another note, this is also a good location to get an Uber to the Arc de Triomphe.

I had most remarkable memory here! There were several guys selling Eiffel tower Souvenirs. One of them approached us and helped us taking all the photo with fun and unique poses. Then he was selling us the souvenir with great deal!  I recommend you to get some great photos and souvenirs here rather than overpriced gift shops.
